intro: Diporochna gilgiana, commonly known as the Gilgian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its fruits are schizocarps, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
